ai_analysis.summary: No significant anomalies detected; the money order appears authentic and consistent across all inspected fields.
reasoning: Issuer and serial number are valid for MoneyGram; serial format conforms to expected 10-digit pattern.
Numeric amount (USD 450.00) exactly matches the correctly spelled written amount (“FOUR HUNDRED FIFTY AND 00/100 DOLLARS”) in the raw OCR text.
Signature field (“AGENT AUTHORIZED SIGNATURE – Alex Chan”) is present and legible.
ML ensemble fraud score is 0.0% with uniformly low RF (33.2%) and XGBoost (3.5%) sub-scores, indicating no learned fraud patterns.
Training data shows 45% of fraud involves amount mismatches; none observed here.
actionable_recommendations: Verify purchaser identity and address with government-issued ID.
Ensure funding source (bank account or cash) aligns with customer’s declared information.
Retain a copy of the money order and customer ID for audit purposes.
ai_analysis.training_insights: The training dataset indicates high risk when numeric and written amounts diverge; this order shows perfect match and correct spelling, aligning with legitimate cases.
ai_analysis.historical_comparison: No similar fraud cases found in the database for new MoneyGram orders with these characteristics.
